title: Avalanche Rescue in California: Skiers Found and Missing
summary: In California, a big snowstorm caused an avalanche that buried skiers in the mountains. Six skiers were found alive, but ten are still missing. Rescue teams are working hard to save them. The avalanche happened near Lake Tahoe, and many emergency responders are helping. The skiers were with guides, and someone called 911 for help. The snow and wind made conditions very dangerous. This story shows how important safety is in snowy areas.

background_read: An avalanche is when snow slides down a mountain quickly, which can be very dangerous for people skiing or hiking. In California, there are big mountains with lots of snow in winter. Rescue teams work to save people in emergencies like this. It's important to be careful and follow safety rules when playing in snowy areas.
